title: US: South Carolina woman pleads guilty in fatal DUI crash that killed bride
content: Jamie Lee Komoroski, a 26-year-old from South Carolina, pleaded guilty to multiple charges in connection with a deadly drunken driving crash that killed a bride and seriously injured the groom just hours after their wedding. The crash occurred in Folly Beach in April 2023. Komoroski faces up to 25 years in prison, with sentencing expected soon.
summary: Jamie Lee Komoroski, a 26-year-old from South Carolina, pleaded guilty to multiple charges in connection with a deadly drunken driving crash that killed a bride and seriously injured the groom just hours after their wedding. The crash occurred in Folly Beach in April 2023. Komoroski faces up to 25 years in prison, with sentencing expected soon.

title: 'All hell to pay': Trump's ultimatum to Hamas to release hostages before 20 Jan
content: President-elect Donald Trump demands the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza before his January 2025 inauguration, warning of severe consequences. Over 100 hostages remain in captivity from the October 2023 Hamas attacks. Israeli officials express gratitude, but negotiations remain tense as Hamas links release to an end of Israeli military operations.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump demands the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza before his January 2025 inauguration, warning of severe consequences. Over 100 hostages remain in captivity from the October 2023 Hamas attacks. Israeli officials express gratitude, but negotiations remain tense as Hamas links release to an end of Israeli military operations.

title: When drunk Pete Hegseth shouted 'kill all Muslims' at a bar on official tour
content: New Yorker cited a previously undisclosed whistleblower report on Hegseth's tenure as the president of Concerned Veterans for America that said Hegseth was found intoxicated while acting in his official capacity and sometimes he needed to be carried out of the organization's events. In 2015, at a bar, Hegseth drunkenly chanted 'kill all Muslims" during the early hours.
summary: New Yorker cited a previously undisclosed whistleblower report on Hegseth's tenure as the president of Concerned Veterans for America that said Hegseth was found intoxicated while acting in his official capacity and sometimes he needed to be carried out of the organization's events. In 2015, at a bar, Hegseth drunkenly chanted 'kill all Muslims" during the early hours.

title: Jill Biden reacts to Hunter's pardon as President cites 'politicised prosecution'
content: First Lady Jill Biden supports President Joe Biden’s decision to pardon Hunter Biden, convicted of federal gun and tax charges. This pardon, covering offenses from 2014 to 2024, follows claims of selective prosecution. While Hunter acknowledged his mistakes during his addiction, the move faced criticism from Republicans, including Donald Trump, who called it an 'abuse of justice'.
summary: First Lady Jill Biden supports President Joe Biden’s decision to pardon Hunter Biden, convicted of federal gun and tax charges. This pardon, covering offenses from 2014 to 2024, follows claims of selective prosecution. While Hunter acknowledged his mistakes during his addiction, the move faced criticism from Republicans, including Donald Trump, who called it an 'abuse of justice'.

title: Meghan Markle's personal calls rejected by Hollywood power players amid divorce rumors
content: Rhere are rumors of Harry and Meghan growing distant as they have already separated their professional ways. Apart from that, they have no sellable content and if Harry and Meghan professionally go two ways, people won't have much interest in either of their lives.

title: Long Island teen tragically dies during charity hockey game
content: Connor Kasin, a 17-year-old Massapequa High School senior, collapsed and passed away during a charity hockey game for Sabrina Navaretta at the Town of Oyster Bay Ice Skating Center, New York. Despite immediate CPR and hospital care, he was pronounced dead. The cause remains unknown, and the community mourns his loss.
summary: Connor Kasin, a 17-year-old Massapequa High School senior, collapsed and passed away during a charity hockey game for Sabrina Navaretta at the Town of Oyster Bay Ice Skating Center, New York. Despite immediate CPR and hospital care, he was pronounced dead. The cause remains unknown, and the community mourns his loss.

title: Who was Omer Maxim Neutra? US- Israeli soldier killed on Oct 7, whose body remains held hostage
content: Captain Omer Maxim Neutra, a 21-year-old Israeli soldier, was confirmed dead after being taken hostage by Hamas during their attack on October 7, 2023. Neutra, a tank platoon commander from New York, served in the IDF. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu assured efforts to return the bodies of all hostages, including Neutra's, for proper burial.
summary: Captain Omer Maxim Neutra, a 21-year-old Israeli soldier, was confirmed dead after being taken hostage by Hamas during their attack on October 7, 2023. Neutra, a tank platoon commander from New York, served in the IDF. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu assured efforts to return the bodies of all hostages, including Neutra's, for proper burial.

title: NYC staffer suspended indefinitely for tearing down Israeli hostage poster
content: Nallah Sutherland, an event coordinator for NYC Mayor Eric Adams, has been indefinitely suspended without pay after a video showed her tearing down an Israeli hostage poster and allegedly assaulting an eyewitness. The suspension follows strong criticism from elected officials and Jewish advocacy groups.
summary: Nallah Sutherland, an event coordinator for NYC Mayor Eric Adams, has been indefinitely suspended without pay after a video showed her tearing down an Israeli hostage poster and allegedly assaulting an eyewitness. The suspension follows strong criticism from elected officials and Jewish advocacy groups.

title: Karine Jean-Pierre reacts to 'why did you and Biden lie' about pardon: 'Because of...'
content: ​On Monday, Jean-Pierre was asked aboard Air Force One why she persistently lied about the issue to which the press secretary reacted by saying: "The president took an action because of how politically infected these cases were." ​“The system doesn’t get corrupted by politics for people whose name is not Biden?” a reporter asked. “You’re twisting and misrepresenting what I’m saying. I’m talking about a particular issue right now,” Jean-Pierre said.
summary: ​On Monday, Jean-Pierre was asked aboard Air Force One why she persistently lied about the issue to which the press secretary reacted by saying: "The president took an action because of how politically infected these cases were." ​“The system doesn’t get corrupted by politics for people whose name is not Biden?” a reporter asked. “You’re twisting and misrepresenting what I’m saying. I’m talking about a particular issue right now,” Jean-Pierre said.

title: ‘Totally possible’: Joe Rogan reacts to Jamie Foxx and Diddy poisoning rumours
content: Joe Rogan and guests discussed the viral rumours about P. Diddy allegedly poisoning Jamie Foxx, leading to Foxx's 2023 hospitalisation. While some eyewitnesses claim Foxx was serious, others believe he may have been joking. A source close to Diddy denied the allegations, amid his ongoing legal issues.
summary: Joe Rogan and guests discussed the viral rumours about P. Diddy allegedly poisoning Jamie Foxx, leading to Foxx's 2023 hospitalisation. While some eyewitnesses claim Foxx was serious, others believe he may have been joking. A source close to Diddy denied the allegations, amid his ongoing legal issues.

title: Russian actress swept to her death by a wave during cliffside yoga in Thailand
content: Kamilla Belyatskaya, a 24-year-old Russian actress, tragically drowned while practising yoga on a cliff in Koh Samui, Thailand, after a wave swept her into the sea. Despite quick rescue attempts, high waves hampered efforts. Her body was later found about two-thirds of a mile away. Local authorities have since restricted access to the dangerous area.
summary: Kamilla Belyatskaya, a 24-year-old Russian actress, tragically drowned while practising yoga on a cliff in Koh Samui, Thailand, after a wave swept her into the sea. Despite quick rescue attempts, high waves hampered efforts. Her body was later found about two-thirds of a mile away. Local authorities have since restricted access to the dangerous area.

title: Bill Gates slammed for calling India 'laboratory to try things'
content: Bill Gates faced criticism on social media after referring to India as a 'laboratory to try things' in a podcast. He highlighted India's difficulties but noted improvements in health, education, and nutrition. Gates emphasized India’s stability and potential as a testing ground for initiatives before implementing them elsewhere. ​"And so our biggest non-US office for the Foundation is in India and the most number of pilot roll out things we're doing anywhere in the world are with partners in India," Bill Gates said.
summary: Bill Gates faced criticism on social media after referring to India as a 'laboratory to try things' in a podcast. He highlighted India's difficulties but noted improvements in health, education, and nutrition. Gates emphasized India’s stability and potential as a testing ground for initiatives before implementing them elsewhere. ​"And so our biggest non-US office for the Foundation is in India and the most number of pilot roll out things we're doing anywhere in the world are with partners in India," Bill Gates said.

title: Elon Musk reveals how he can be influenced: 'Money, power, threats silly...'
content: Elon Musk announced that the easiest way to reach him is through well-reasoned arguments on X, and offers of money, power, or threats are ineffective. He made the statement as he reacted to a Washington Post article that detailed how Elon Musk does not believe in spokespersons to put out his words and this is also a problem for people who want to reach him.
summary: Elon Musk announced that the easiest way to reach him is through well-reasoned arguments on X, and offers of money, power, or threats are ineffective. He made the statement as he reacted to a Washington Post article that detailed how Elon Musk does not believe in spokespersons to put out his words and this is also a problem for people who want to reach him.

title: 'Big fat Indian wedding': JD Vance's picture with wife's family goes viral
content: A photo of US vice president-elect JD Vance with his wife Usha Vance's Indian family has gone viral, countering accusations of racism and showcasing his bond with Indian culture. Social media users praised his integration and shared a range of supportive reactions.
summary: A photo of US vice president-elect JD Vance with his wife Usha Vance's Indian family has gone viral, countering accusations of racism and showcasing his bond with Indian culture. Social media users praised his integration and shared a range of supportive reactions.

title: Ghost lake returns: Tulare Lake resurfaces after 130 years, submerging 94,000 acres of farmland
content: Tulare Lake, having been drained in the 19th century for agriculture, has reappeared in California's San Joaquin Valley after massive winter storms and snowmelt. Reclaiming around 94,000 acres, the lake now engulfs farmland, raising environmental concerns, but also reviving local wildlife and ecosystems.
summary: Tulare Lake, having been drained in the 19th century for agriculture, has reappeared in California's San Joaquin Valley after massive winter storms and snowmelt. Reclaiming around 94,000 acres, the lake now engulfs farmland, raising environmental concerns, but also reviving local wildlife and ecosystems.

title: Morning Joe plays Kash Patel's 'we are coming after you' clip thrice: 'This is bad for Donald Trump'
content: ​"Yes, we’re going to come after the people in the media who lied about American citizens, who helped Joe Biden rig presidential elections," Patel said in that 2023 interview with Steve Bannon. “We’re going to come after you. Whether it’s criminally or civilly, we’ll figure that out. But yeah, we’re putting you all on notice," he said.
summary: ​"Yes, we’re going to come after the people in the media who lied about American citizens, who helped Joe Biden rig presidential elections," Patel said in that 2023 interview with Steve Bannon. “We’re going to come after you. Whether it’s criminally or civilly, we’ll figure that out. But yeah, we’re putting you all on notice," he said.

title: Nate Silver enraged over Biden pardoning son: 'Don't vote for any Democrat in 2028 who...'
content: Nate Silver expressed frustration after President Joe Biden's surprising pardon of his son Hunter Biden, who was convicted of illegal gun possession, lying about addiction, and tax evasion. Silver criticized the White House for misleading post-election assurances and urged Democrats to repudiate the pardon. "Don't vote for any Democrat in 2028 who doesn't repudiate the pardon within 48 hours," Nate Silver posted
summary: Nate Silver expressed frustration after President Joe Biden's surprising pardon of his son Hunter Biden, who was convicted of illegal gun possession, lying about addiction, and tax evasion. Silver criticized the White House for misleading post-election assurances and urged Democrats to repudiate the pardon. "Don't vote for any Democrat in 2028 who doesn't repudiate the pardon within 48 hours," Nate Silver posted

title: 'I don’t want to go to heaven': Ohio girl pleads with father not to kill her during standoff with cops in chilling audio
content: A distressing audio of seven-year-old Oaklynn Alexander pleading with her father during a police standoff in Ohio has gone viral. Her non-custodial father, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped her, leading to a tense situation where he threatened both their lives. Police intervened, resulting in his death but Oaklynn's safe recovery.
summary: A distressing audio of seven-year-old Oaklynn Alexander pleading with her father during a police standoff in Ohio has gone viral. Her non-custodial father, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped her, leading to a tense situation where he threatened both their lives. Police intervened, resulting in his death but Oaklynn's safe recovery.

title: Belgium loses case against women taken from mothers in colonial era
content: The Belgian state was ordered to compensate five mixed-race women who were forcibly placed in an orphanage 70 years ago under a colonial-era practice. The court deemed the abductions a crime against humanity. This ruling marks a historic first for colonial-era reparation cases.
summary: The Belgian state was ordered to compensate five mixed-race women who were forcibly placed in an orphanage 70 years ago under a colonial-era practice. The court deemed the abductions a crime against humanity. This ruling marks a historic first for colonial-era reparation cases.

title: Who is Hallie Olivere who found brother-in-law and ex Hunter Biden's gun in 2018?
content: In October 2018, Hallie Biden found a gun in Hunter Biden's truck. She panicked and discarded the gun in a trash can near a grocery store that had CCTV cameras. Police found the gun and it was traced back to Hunter Biden. Hallie and Hunter were in a relationship at that time as both of them were coping with Beau Biden's death. Hallie said Hunter introduced her to drugs.
summary: In October 2018, Hallie Biden found a gun in Hunter Biden's truck. She panicked and discarded the gun in a trash can near a grocery store that had CCTV cameras. Police found the gun and it was traced back to Hunter Biden. Hallie and Hunter were in a relationship at that time as both of them were coping with Beau Biden's death. Hallie said Hunter introduced her to drugs.
